textbooks.title: Organizational Behavior
textbooks.author: Hitt, M.A., Miller, C.C., Collela, A.

textbooks.title: Managing the Risks of Organizational Accidents
textbooks.author: Reason, J.

grading.policies: 20% of the total points will be deducted for assignments received 1-6 days late; assignments received more than 1 week late will receive 0 points.

assignments.description: Defining an Organizational Accident project working in teams of 3-4 members. Details provided in separate documents.

policies.attendance: Attendance points will be given when students visualize the lecture podcast in the due week.
policies.late_work: 20% of the total points will be deducted for assignments received 1-6 days late; assignments received more than 1 week late will receive 0 points.
policies.academic_integrity: Students are bound by the Graduate Student Code of Academic Integrity.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: This course is fully online. Classes are asynchronous.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Basic computer and web-browsing skills, live web conferencing using Zoom, recording a slide presentation with audio narration.
additional_info.support_resources: Contact the Technology Resource and Assistance Center (TRAC) for support.

course_info.title: The management of the Development Enterprise

instructor.name: Luca Iandoli
instructor.office_hours: by appointment to be scheduled over e-mail

_metadata.course_description: This course introduces the attributes associated with the design and management of the human activity system that is responsible for developing and operating an organization.
learning_outcomes: Develop a scientific understanding of organizational behavior concepts and theories and their applications to management context and work situations.
Apply several methodologies for organizational analysis based on system thinking perspective.
Develop skills and techniques to effectively design and manage engineering teams in organizations.
